overview_of_class: The goal of this course is to provide an overview of auditory and vestibular pathologies. Students will learn about the various disorders of the outer ear, middle ear, inner ear and peripheral vestibular system. For each disorder, the focus will be on the audiological and vestibular clinical manifestations as well as audiological and medical management. Discussion will include auditory embryology and genetic factors associated with hearing loss and vestibular disorders.
name: Pathologies of the Auditory System
title: SoC CSD 420-0-20 Pathologies of the Auditory System
enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Reserved for Doctor of Audiology students only.

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: The goal of this course is to provide an overview of auditory and vestibular pathologies. Students will learn about the various disorders of the outer ear, middle ear, inner ear and peripheral vestibular system. For each disorder, the focus will be on the audiological and vestibular clinical manifestations as well as audiological and medical management. Discussion will include auditory embryology and genetic factors associated with hearing loss and vestibular disorders.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Currently enrolled in the Doctor of Audiology program or by instructor permission.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
At the completion of this course, students will be able to:

  • Identify the auditory and vestibular disorders that arise from alterations in the development of the peripheral systems. (A1)

  • Identify the difference between syndromic and nonsyndromic hearing loss. Identify the known genetic factors associated with each. (A2)

  • Identify pharmacologic agents that cause hearing loss and vestibular disorders. Identify the audiological and vestibular profiles associated with this type of toxicity. (A8)

  • Identify auditory and vestibular pathology based on information from audiological, vestibular and/or medical evaluation. Understand how individuals with these pathologies are audiologically and/or medically managed. (A10)

  • Discuss relevant research findings in the context of auditory and vestibular pathologies. (F2)

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Musiek, F.E., Baran, J.A., Shinn, J.B., Jones, R.O. (2012). Disorders of the Auditory System. San Diego, CA: Plural Publishing

subject: CSD
